content: Even so, last year's second quarter performance was heavily fueled by government stimulus payments, and even so we are now facing higher costs compared to last year, we still managed to maintain the same 27% EBITDA margin. In Missouri, we went from $10.4 million, and that's always taken further of '20 -- and this is of 2022, from $10.4 million in April, $9.6 million in May, and $9 million in June, and again, in July, north of $9 million -- significantly north of $9 million.
